summary: This is an email chain between prosecutors and defense counsel regarding discovery in the US v. Maxwell case. Defense attorney Laura Menninger requests spreadsheets containing links and metadata for photo/video evidence from FBI hard drives, and seeks clarification about the origin and metadata of specific videos from the Florida investigation.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell; writes to prosecutors requesting spreadsheets of photo/video evidence and metadata for videos from the Florida investigation.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on the email from Laura Menninger regarding discovery issues in the US v. Maxwell case.

connections.description: Both are attorneys involved in the Maxwell defense, with Pagliuca copied on Menninger's discovery request to prosecutors.

events.title: Evidence production in Maxwell case
events.description: Prosecutors produced a video (SDNY_2762476) to the defense team as part of discovery.

keyFacts: Defense attorney Laura Menninger requests spreadsheets from FBI hard drives that contain links to photo files and extracted data, to track reviewed evidence.
Menninger notes that photographs lack Bates numbers, making it difficult to maintain a record of which photos have been reviewed.
Menninger questions the origin and metadata of videos labeled 'Video from Florida Investigation', asking for details on how and when they were seized.
